thread.section_title: Buying Business Travel | For Business, Corporate Travel & Meeting Buyers & Arrangers
thread.title: Chambers Events reports 70% turnover growth

title: Chambers Events reports 70% turnover growth
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Thu, 16 Jul 2015 11:09 Follow @thomasnewcombe Chambers Travel Events has reported a 70 per cent growth in turnover for the past year after winning new business worth £2.8 million since 2014.
The full service agency, part of Chambers Travel Group, said turnover totalled £7.2 million helped by a 40 per cent increase in new business.
This included a five-day technology conference in Dublin held at the Doubletree by Hilton Burlington Road in March as well as managing travel for 700 delegates attending the Martini 150 event in Italy last September.
Chambers Events has also boosted its team with the promotion of Hannah Fletcher to senior account director.
Fletcher first joined Chambers Travel Events in 2013 as event manager, before taking on the role of EMEA marketing manager for Chambers Travel Group in 2014.
In December last year, Corporate Travel Management acquired Chambers Travel, which was 14 in BBT’s 2015 Top 50 UK TMCs, for £39 million over three years.
Read an interview BBT did with Chambers Travel CEO Chris Thelen.
